website_summaries.verdict: Cuts unbelievably well for a small, affordable bandsaw when set up properly, but adjusting the tension can be difficult and tedious.
pros: Makes excellent, very high-quality cuts that rival the results of much more expensive tools
Includes a flexible work light, fence, and miter gauge
cons: Absolutely must be aligned correctly in order to produce a good cut, but it can be very sensitive and finicky to set up with the plastic tension adjustment knob

customer_reviews.title: Assembly and actual ease of use are great but I can't recommend this because the bearing cover ...
customer_reviews.text: Assembly and actual ease of use are great but I can't recommend this because the bearing cover came off on its first use. There was also a small chrome crimp pin that broke off from somewhere and was found in the lower wheel chamber. There is no way to re-seat the bearing cover which leaves the bearings exposed to every piece of dust and debris created during cutting. I also haven't had the best experience trying to get this resolved as well.
customer_reviews.author: AmznAddct

customer_reviews.title: Blade change impossible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son-in-law for Christmas. Initially it worked well, but then the blade needed to be replaced. He had trouble getting the blade off and was never able to get a new one on, in part due to the top wheel wobbling so much. He called WEN tech support but they were unable to help. There were no local support techs in the Phoenix area. He brought it to an experienced woodworking store that sells bandsaws, and they were unable install a new blade and commented on the strange wobbly upper wheel. He would have had to disassemble it and pay for return shipping. He decided to write it off as a loss. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Total Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: The bandsaw looks much nicer than it actually is. Everything is made from thin, flimsy aluminum. Tolerances are terrible. It took 10 minutes just to get the blade off because of the way the mast is designed with a narrow slot. It took another 15 minutes of messing around with the wheel tilt to get the new blade to stay on the wheel. When it is running, it sounds like the blade is rubbing in several places. The blade wanders all over and the table top won't stay perpendicular to the blade. Of course, the table top is a flimsy, thin piece of crappy aluminum as well so what do you expect? All in all, a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wont track, tension knob broke. useless
customer_reviews.text: Where to begin...out of the box the blade would not track. Minor tilt adjustments would cause the blade jump from the back of the wheel all the way to the front of the wheel. Tracking on the bottom wheel was all over the place, but never in the center. Worse of all the tension knob broke after a couple weeks. Its made of plastic. With a broken tension knob, the upper wheel hangs lower makng it impossible to tension any blade. Do not waste time on this. You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: B. S.

customer_reviews.title: Good diy saw.  Great value for small shop saw.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little saw. Be careful assembling the base as you have to level it before you tighten or it will wobble. But handy saw. Decent size table. And the fence is a nice feature that has been handy already. All in all great value for the money for a diy saw. But don’t expect it to perform like a $2000 band saw. Wish the base had wheels you could tilt it onto to move. But I move it around on a furniture dolly when I need to. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: DF_EE

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets for this tier bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: The WEN 3962 greatly exceeded my expectations. The assembly and calibration went much easier than I was expecting - I was cutting in about an hour. My primary use is for rough cutting parts to be finished with a flush trim router bit, and it certainly does that well. Out of curiosity I tried resawing some ~6x8x24 blocks of oak. It got the job done well enough to move the parts over to the planer, but really it's not something I'd frequently require from this machine. If large resawing projects are your application you might be better off saving up for a more expensive machine.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kranyec

customer_reviews.title: Remember Wen?
customer_reviews.text: Great little bandsaw for the price. I keep saying Wen makes a great product and they do, you just need to be a bit handy and willing to put in the time to set it up properly. Changing blades is pretty straight forward- they have a tendency to settle themselves as long as you don't over tighten the wheel. The fence is effective although the scale is a bit useless and I might be weird but I don't understand the point of a miter gauge for a bandsaw however one is included (a very basic one) bottom line, if you're a hobbyist or just getting started, this is the droid you're looking for.
customer_reviews.author: clint W.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: Bandsaw box arrived in great condition, product well packaged. Setup was quite easy, and build quality was excellent. First, the bandsaw is very quiet. I'm replacing an old small ryobi that sounds like a tablesaw. This unit is whisper quiet. I kept the belt on the low speed pully, at least for now. I first cut some 1" oak and it handled it with ease. I then grabbed a 1x6 piece of oak and ripped it on the 6" depth and it cut superb, straight and no blade drift. I was more than happy with the outcome. In the end, this bandsaw is a no brainer if you're looking in the 10" size category.
customer_reviews.author: MGCouture

customer_reviews.title: In summary: great tool at great price!
customer_reviews.text: After reading earlier reviews I ordered this tool being prepared for time consuming setup or modifications. It took me approximately 40 min to set this tool accordingly to instruction. I found that most of issues reported by the “Candid Reviewer” (3 stars review) were not exaggerated. After additional 90 minutes to correct lower guide, using grinder and some patience to properly adjust upper guide I made perfect cuts. Since then – tools work great! After over 100 hours of intensive use I have not found any weaknesses in materials or principal design, no broken knobs reported by other reviewers. I would give 5 stars without hesitations if saw would not have mentioned flaws with lower and upper guide.
customer_reviews.author: CompuGeak

customer_reviews.title: Great tool--my second one!
customer_reviews.text: We have a bird carving club. I bought the smaller version of this saw and within a week added this one so that we can cut blanks from larger blocks. Worked perfectly out of the box. Both saws got 3-hour workouts their first weekend and work flawlessly. This was $300 less than and equivalent saw at Lowes. Great product. If you're struggling with an older saw (like I was), you'll wonder why you didn't do this a long time ago!
customer_reviews.author: Arpeggio Garden

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the money. The band and guide adjustments aren't as dubious as you may think. Back off all rollers, adjust the band tension and get it centered on the upper wheel then move all the rollers in until they just about touch the band. Have had it set that way since my first cut and have been happy with the cuts. Remember to lower the upper guide to within 1/2"(when possible) of the item being cut and you'll get straight cuts every time.
customer_reviews.author: A Concerned Customer

customer_reviews.title: One speed, no frills, basic tool.
customer_reviews.text: If you use a band saw from time to time, but not all the time, and price is important, this is a solid, basic one speed saw, with no work light, and few features that will do the job. The saw cuts aluminum, plastics, and brass easily. Mild steel takes longer, and is manageable with care. The handle on top is a convenient feature if you have limited work space and want to move the saw on to your bench only when you intend to use it. This is an45 pound saw. Better 9 inch saws, like the Rikon, tend to weigh 70 pounds or more. For best results use a premium grade blade.
customer_reviews.author: Maneki Neko

customer_reviews.title: Cutting edge technology.
customer_reviews.text: I have needed a bandsaw for quite a while, the price on this unit was bothe the best and size wise is a bit better than a tabletop unit. It’s not huge and is fairly easy to move for my size in this limited space. I watched a setup video on YouTube and realized this saw will be relatively simple to maintain but will require a diligent set of observation skills, I look forward to many cutting projects being fulfilled over time.
customer_reviews.author: kolleartist

customer_reviews.title: Good band saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've now owned this band saw for a couple of months and so far I like it quite a bit. It's been great for cutting circles and arcs. The stand sits a little unevenly in my garage but the concrete itself is a little uneven. It would have been nice if the stand came with adjustable feet to assist with leveling. I haven't found the project light to be of much use because of it's positioning. It would have been nicer to have on the opposite side but that is a personal preference. Overall, the saw has been reliable for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Overall great saw.
customer_reviews.text: For years, my Delta 18inch, 230v, woodworking industrial bandsaw was my favorite tool. (see review) Unfortunately I had to let it go when I moved. This Wen is a light, reasonably priced, smaller version of the same basic tool. It was easy to put together. Runs beautifully. Straightforward to tune and adjust. Practical, useful, well-designed.
customer_reviews.author: Naromiyocknowhusunkatank

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this bandsaw for a while now, maybe 2 years. Works good, but have a problem with the blade guide. It has started galling up, and is a pain to raise and lower now. Wish the light was mounted on the front of the saw, not the back. You have limited adjustments on the guide bearings for this saw. They should not spin until there is pressure applied to the blade. I have struggled to get them set right, and have to adjust about every 3 project or so. Not a deal breaker though and it forces me to keep up with my maintnce.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend this Product - Very Poor customer support and no replacement guide bearings!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in June of 2017 The lower guide bearings have seized up. Don't spin, and thus cause extra friction to the blade. I called Wen customer support only to leave them a message and have not heard back from them. I read another review which the person complained of seized up bearings and apparently Wen doesn't sell them any longer. WEN should advise customers on what to buy if they no longer stand by their product. I believe the bearings they outfit in this band saw should have been of a quality that is more sealed or basically better quality. I have other WEN products unfortunately, and frankly the buck will stop here.
customer_reviews.author: Chinjazz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, tracks well out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Put this together fairly quickly with minimal fuss. Blade tracks well and cuts effectively, albeit fairly slowly. That said, being an entry-level 9inch saw I can't expect it do anything too fancy. If you are looking to make a few curved cuts on stock thicker than you can work on a scroll saw, this is the saw for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tangent

customer_reviews.title: Laughably ineffective
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible. I guess you can't expect much from such a cheap product, but it should at least be able to cut through 6" wood. I adjusted it to the lowest rpm and the cutting power was a joke. Additionally, the fence and the work surface are super thin and low quality. Super inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: This is another cheap import that many retailers get and just stick their paint and brand on. I dont know if Wen actually spec'd better parts or what, but this saw is actually pretty good and runs true and has decent power for the price point. I cut mesquite and oak blanks on this saw and get great results, even with the bade that came on it. I upgraded the blade of course, but was impressed with how it works right out of the box. Works great re-sawing stuff up to about 3" thick...then it bogs down a lot, but great for small pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Cone

customer_reviews.title: Works great for ripping wood
customer_reviews.text: This saw works great to make smaller short logs into square boards to plane down. The only thing I do not like is the T-square attachment is a little looser then I would like it to be. I am sure it will be easier to use the more I use it. I was cutting several logs of Black walnut this past weekend. As anyone knows wood from any walnut tree gets really hard after it ages for 2 years. So you have to go slow or it will break the blade.
customer_reviews.author: william ulrick

customer_reviews.title: Good saw
customer_reviews.text: The saw is great for the price. Take your time to set it up. Plenty of videos to assist. This is my first, but I have plenty of experience with band saws. Some of the parts are kind of cheap, but so is the unit!! It took about 45 minutes to assemble and get my blade set. My first cut was a 3/4 plywood circle. The saw exceeded my expectations on a 3/8 blade. Next cut was a 1 inch thick red oak, again the saw did what it was designed for. I took 1 star out because instructions are not good enough for a beginner. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Allyson M. Saad

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good saw for the money.
customer_reviews.text: If you are a hobby woodworker not needing accurate resaw capability then this is a pretty good saw. Right out of the box it needed very little fine tuning. Table surface is a little rough and I had to make a thicker throat plate as the recess was deeper than the thickness of the plate. All in all a pretty good saw for the money.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: great price and value
customer_reviews.text: It works just as advertised, set up was pretty easy, maybe 45 minutes or less, and I have had some great success with it cutting shapes and re-sawing to create nice veneers.. The only drawback is the fence locks down out of true, by just a small amount, so I recheck it and clamp the free end to the work surface once i have it square.. The miter attachment is not all that accurate, but if you check with a square, you can get accurate 90 and 45 degree crosscuts..
customer_reviews.author: Davis S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Got it just this AM and set it up. After reading reviews and video's I was all set to do a major alignment. To my surprise and joy, this saw was pretty much spot on. I had to square the table and that was it! Cuts straight and smooth and I get to keep more pennies in my pocket. I was going to get a Rikon as I've had great luck with their lathe but when this sale came up, I took the risk and am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tish

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, plenty of power, very pleased with saw
customer_reviews.text: Wow sooo impressed with this little saw. Took all of 15 minutes to set up, directions very straight forward and easy to follow, saw was practically ready to use. Slight adjustment to blade tension and off we went. I Tested it by cross cutting a 6X6 treated post. Using slight pressure on “high speed“ belt setting it cut through post in 11 seconds with no problem. Being that will be the largest task I myself will ask of this saw it will no doubt be perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Edens

customer_reviews.title: Shop pal
customer_reviews.text: Received as ordered and in adequate packaging... Set up is easy...especially installing the legs... I know since the fourth time I got it right... Do not tighten as you go (As stated in the instructions) Guess you read then after the third attempt.? The next adventure was adjusting the guides and blade tracking... Three hours later and in 90 degree heat the job was done... I watched numerous videos on setting up a bandsaw and this was most helpful...However, as stated in other reviews, adjusting the guides is not for the easily frustrated.. Bottom line: Well made, good fence, adequate instructions... Cons: not easy to adjust...
customer_reviews.author: rvanparys

customer_reviews.title: A well designed product!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this band saw extensively for the past 5 months and I discover something impressive about it every time I use it. Whoever designed this machine, did an excellent job. Whenever you buy this bandsaw, make sure you buy some quality blades of different widths. The blade that comes on the saw is fine for rough work, but does not cut as smooth as a good, quality blade. The work-light that comes on it is not very good, so buy a good magnetic light from Harbor Freight that you can place where you need it to see the blade cutting. I highly recommend this machine; the design and accuracy for its low-price is excellent.

customer_reviews.title: Watch out!
customer_reviews.text: This band saw could be a great machine this one just had some serious flaws. After the second use the drive pulleys started making noise, then it started pulling to one side even after adjusting it. The drive belt became loose so tightening it became a serious challenge. So in the middle of a project the bandsaw became overall useless. Not even a month of use and it was junk. My only advice is that if you don’t know how to overhaul these machines then don’t purchase it at least this model. In my opinion if you have to do anything outside of adjusting then don’t purchase.
customer_reviews.author: B Page

customer_reviews.title: It worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The setup was fairly easy and I've been impressed with results of my work. I deal mostly in rough cut lumber and a resawing capability is important to me. You just lose too much of the plank to the table say kerf without a bandsaw. I haven't done any work requiring accuracy and I don't intend to. Accuracy is for a scroll saw.
customer_reviews.author: robert Farmer

customer_reviews.title: love this little saw
customer_reviews.text: bought this saw to add to my mini woodshop. the multi-speed is nice and it came in on point. no calibration needed. the plate had a large scratch on it but its a tool and will be scratched anyway. the stand is ok but i don't like the fact the feet are rubber. i would have liked to see metal feet with pre-drilled holes for secure mounting
customer_reviews.author: rbaisden

customer_reviews.title: After a bit of tuning
customer_reviews.text: Great budget band saw. You will have to take your time and learn how to balance and tune the saw. Cons: Location of the light. It is on the back of the blade not the front (cutting side). Vacuum port, It doesn't capture as it should. Fence system is meh!!! Overall, it is a good band saw that will get the job done with a decent price point.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: This product came with a top wheel that wobbled during operation. The bottom wheel was not properly installed and was crooked. Tech support was no help. They just stated I did not know what was going on. I had a friend come over to help. Hes been working with bandsaw 30 years. He showed me the problems with this saw. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Spring

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: This saw is really nice its smooth cut clearance is more than usual and it is easy to maintain and adjust. The one thing I would change is the position of the work light. The way it is it shines on the work from the back and right into eyes of the user. If you can avoid the light the intense reflection of the table makes it very hart d use. However if the light was on the front of the machine it would shine onto the work but away from the user. This would make the work light much more effective
customer_reviews.author: Mike kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good value if you need to cut thick pieces
customer_reviews.text: Could not find another saw anywhere that could handle 6" thick pieces without costing well over $500, so I took a chance on this one. And I am glad I did! The LED work light is very bright and easy to use. The saw is very quiet and cuts very well. Expect to throw away the included blade and order another one ASAP, it's made for rough cuts and is not very sharp. .
customer_reviews.author: J. Roper

customer_reviews.title: sweet machine
customer_reviews.text: it gives you a smooth cut and it is very quiet. like a lot of others my main gripe is with the fence. it doesnt lock down on both ends. when you do lock it to the length of cut you are looking for it wants to jump over about 1/16 of an inch. i compensate by setting the marker a bit shy of the line and then lock it down. this usually takes care of accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: william c freeh

customer_reviews.title: small but, mighty
customer_reviews.text: I had much larger band saws in the past but, not have features like this one does. easy to adjust and clean. The LED light is a major plus on this saw. very bright and can move to where you need it. thickness up to 6 inches works great. I cut as thin as 1/4 in. very sturdy and has enough power for all my needs.
customer_reviews.author: anthony merlo

customer_reviews.title: Compare to the name brands
customer_reviews.text: DO the research and you'll find this is the same unit as (Insert name brand here) with just different paint and stickers for a lot less money. Easy to set up and use right from the box, 20 minutes or less. Easy adjustments for height, speed, etc. Quiet and smooth operation, steady fence and good design. Love the hook up for my dust collector, works great. Stand is steady for most uses or you can mount it to your bench.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value but Questions about Durability
customer_reviews.text: Good value since it has a 2 year warranty. It is a little sensitive to adjust tension and tracking. I am currently waiting to hear from Wen about replacing the Blade Tension Knob/Shaft since the knob fell off after about 3 months of occasional use. Knob plastic cracked. Will update this review based on Wen Response. Also the dust collector opening does NOT fit my shop vacuum which is a pretty standard size. Will also see if Wen has an adapter for this or if I can make one myself. Overall not unhappy with it but I would look more carefully before purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter74

customer_reviews.title: Light stopped working after 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I've been happy with my purchase until yesterday when the light just stopped working. 3 weeks old & the light just stopped working. Don't see any way to contact anyone to request a replacement light. Spent a lot of money for a defective product. This would be a major problem to try to return it. I recommend that you buy something like this locally so that you can take it back easily if you have issues.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Devine

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It seems more and more of my tools are being replaced with this brand. All work flawless and this band saw is no exception. The cuts I get (after tuning) are far above what I expected. The work area is great and I've had no problems with the fence system. I was able to scroll through a 3 inch block fir without slowing down the motor on it's highest speed. I have also used this to resaw wood the cuts were clean and accurate. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a reasonably priced bandsaw.
customer_reviews.author: User 5945

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. It's definitely a good bandsaw for beginners and worth the money if you are doing smaller projects. I've only had mine 2 weeks and I've already learned to stay away from cheaper blades doing bandsaw boxes. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: champ 299

customer_reviews.title: Sorry but if you love woodwoking...no
customer_reviews.text: I had to try it. There is a point where cheapness and quality cross. This crosses to the wrong side. I will keep it for something not sure what. You must spend $300 more at least as of todays offerings if you want better. Rough cut too idk if blade change helps and guides move around. The guide holders are flexible too.
customer_reviews.author: Buy allot of stuff

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Dust port is awesome. Didn't have to tune the blade at all. Fence is awesome. Light is cool. Quiet. I used it the other day to re-saw 2 1/4" X 6" tall Walnut for a table I'm working on and it handled that no problem. With the fence I seem to use it for ripping lumber more than my table saw these days. Me and this little band saw are going to be good friends for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Christian L.

customer_reviews.title: I own several band saws, you will like this one.
customer_reviews.text: I have or had several band saws ranging from 9-17 inches from several different companies. This one replaced a 9" craftsman that replaced a 9" Grizzly. It's a great machine for the money. Very well packed and easy to set up which will take some time. It feels solid, runs relatively quietly, and cuts very well.
customer_reviews.author: RockJockMatt

customer_reviews.title: Passed the Nickel Test!
customer_reviews.text: Nice bandsaw for a small shop. I got it passed the "Nickel Test" right out of the box, very pleased with my machine.
customer_reviews.author: AMG

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the money
customer_reviews.text: This bandsaw is great for the price. No alignment issues, working surface is square with the blade, blade adjustment/change is quick and easy. A little under powered but nothing to get upset about. It has cut through red oak, white oak, black walnut and SYP without issue. The dimensions are accurate as far as thickness and depth of cut capabilities. The fence is only two inches so put your own on. The only negative in my opinion is the stand. To low for me at 6’ 2” and feels flimsy. But I used this opportunity to build my own custom stand.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: After assembling the stand, the saw worked fine without further adjustment. The blade was correctly tensioned and sawed straight. My only criticism is of the aluminum table and the worklight. I would have preferred an iron table so as to use a magnetic re-saw fence, but that was not a deal-breaker. The location of the worklight behind the blade reflects off the shiny aluminum, making it virtually useless for seeing the cutting. I purchased a magnetic-base, flexible holder and a small led flashlight so as to focus the light directly on tooth side of the blade and away from the operator.
customer_reviews.author: TomM

customer_reviews.title: WEN 3962 Bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: Great bandsaw for the money. The base was slightly bent out of shape (cosmetic in nature). Also, adjusting the blade guides under the table (and above) requires some trial and error. I have just used the standard blade that came with the saw and not tried a thinner blade yet.
customer_reviews.author: Speed

customer_reviews.title: A very quite bandsaw well built ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Band saw for my hobby/building maintenance the#1 reason I picked the Wen brand was more positive reviews I read and also my researching the brand and their products. It's an easy set-up. If you are new to using a bandsaw you can get assistance through the company. I got it late yesterday (Saturday) and put it together easy to check and adjust all necessary components tested it out and found an extremely well made saw that is user friendly. 5 star's to Wen 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Neal A. Brandon

customer_reviews.title: WEN does it again! Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy set up! This band saw is the best deal out there! I bought a mag fence and I can cut thin 1/8 inch thick by 6” high pieces like butter and it’s ease it just amazing the blade was also changed to the woodslicer resaw blade by Highland Woodworking! Way to go WEN!!
customer_reviews.author: Homazur

customer_reviews.title: Take your time, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to wood working but this saw is pretty great so far. I've read the reviews sawing this band saw is hard to set up and all that. And the hardest part for me was assembling the stand. The bolt holes for the legs didn't line up so I ended up mounting it to a stand I had already. But I watched some YouTube tutorials about setting up band saw and after an hour I had a saw which could cut 1/16" thick or a thinner even. Just take your time adjusting the blade and bearings and you'll have a very accurate and easy to use saw.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Germscheid

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This saw has been through a lot of cutting. I used it to cut 2x6 boards the tall way. The saw managed to do okay cutting through but cuts at that height tended to drift. The plastic knob at the top broke off from too much sun exposure. Everything else has been working great, especially since it's been outdoors all summer and winter.
customer_reviews.author: LiquidShadow

customer_reviews.title: Buy Amazon products, get Chinese quality!
customer_reviews.text: "Brand new bandsaw from the factory, and one of the guide adjustment knobs is cross threaded and impossible to adjust (the bearing is up against the blade), making the saw completely inoperable. Typical amazon quality. Now we have to fight to get the thing fixed with the pretend "protection plan".
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Good saw, poor blade
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad bandsaw. Time will tell how it holds up. For the money, I rolled the dice. I like the fence, the big controls (for my poor eyesight) and the built in LED lamp, but the blade that comes on the saw isn't awesome. If you are like me, and on a very tight budget, leave yourself enough in reserve to buy a good blade. Even trying to resaw some 5" wide 10/4 poplar, the saw literally stopped dead in its tracks. Tension and tires were all checked before I switched to a 4 TPI blade, and it was much better. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shelving Man

customer_reviews.title: Very nice band saw for the money !
customer_reviews.text: An amazing band saw for the money. Use it right and it's your friend and it has everything you need to make effortless cuts. Adjustable blade guide, fence, angle guide, adjustable table, two speeds, work light, they've given you everything for you to succeed. Nice !
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up for those who have at least some manual dexterity.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't looking for a heavy duty, re-saw bandsaw as most of my work consists of smallish projects. Easy enough to maneuver around my shop without needing to put it on casters. Flex-arm worklight is nice as I can see exactly where I'm cutting. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: No name

customer_reviews.title: Jammed blade guard.  Accuracy headache. But it cuts!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap! Bad for cutting veneers or re-sawing with little waste. Great for screwing around and doing rough work. 1. Adjusting the runners is NEAR IMPOSSIBLE. When tightening the top side bearing, your Allen wrench leverage moves the head assembly out of position. A constant battle! 2. The extendable blade guard was not lined up. Took me 90 minutes to disassemble and install a couple spacer/washers so it would line up. 3. The blade guard gear can get jammed with sawdust. Use dust collection, or you’ll be in for a headache! Now that the price is $250 I am not sure it is worth the headaches. Ante up for a $600 model that will be more accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Max Reeder

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I need
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, works great for what I need. I am just getting into wood working and don't have a lot of money to buy expensive tools. I bought this for the size and price point and so far I've been very impressed. Very easy to assemble, and does what I need so far.
customer_reviews.author: James T

customer_reviews.title: Need replacement part
customer_reviews.text: Amazon/Wen --- just assembled the saw and the lower wheel housing knob was broken. I understand there is a cut-out in the knob to secure the cover but there is a second and larger space due to breakage during packing/shipping. I don't want to return the entire item, just get the housing knob replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: After a few months of use the band saw seems ...
customer_reviews.text: After a few months of use the band saw seems to be holding up and working well. I didn't have much of the issues as some other reviewers have had with blade alignment. My only complaint would be the fence, it has a little play in it and is not completely level. You won't be able to rely on the fence alone to get a straight and flush cut.
customer_reviews.author: chris voorhies

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: Love this so far. Very easy to assemble and result is a sturdy band saw that has plenty of cutting range and features.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I like the saw but all the reviews made comments about a cast iron deck and mine came with a cast aluminum deck. To me that was a big negative. If I would have known this I wouldn't have ordered it. Sure it is a very good saw for the money and does what it says it does, but that aluminum deck make me kinda a shame to show it off to friends. I'm not sure when they (Wen) changed to aluminum, but they should say it in the description.
customer_reviews.author: kpo101

customer_reviews.title: Great band saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have no regrets in buying the band saw. The saw itself is great quality with clear instructions. The table is a mess and you'll need to bend some metal to put it together. This is the first band saw I've owned, but it has met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Decent saw for the money, missing parts, very wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Assembly wasn't too hard other than the missing screws. Once I got additional hardware it came together well. My biggest annoyance is that the base is extremely wobbly (yes i tested my floor for flatness). The retaining pin for the top wheel was also missing and was causing me all sorts of headaches getting it setup. Overall though, once I got it running and dialed in. The thing works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Trophy

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool, better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Although there is some assembly to do it is quite easy to accomplish in less than and hour. Up and running it fits all my expectations especially to cutting wood lathe turning rounds out of stock 6" in thickness. There is a nice, medium use blade and I am certain that it will perform even better with a premium blade. Nice tool, adjustable in straight forward manner, good power and well worth the very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Steadily cut curves with thin kerf.
customer_reviews.text: I am super happy with Wen Products so far! This bandsaw works great for cutting curves and I love how thin of a cut you can get. Used out on redwood to cut a nice curve on top of side boards for planter boxes and making some kids wooden toys so far. If you want a band saw for small-medium projects that's gonna work steadily and not breakthe bank, this is the best option I've found. Thanks again Wen!
customer_reviews.author: James Swell

customer_reviews.title: You've found it
customer_reviews.text: I should have reviewed this a long time ago. This bandsaw is at the top of it's class, by far. Have used it for years and I would and still recommend it to anyone with the budget in mind. The resaw capacity is larger than any other in it's class, and works so super smooth. Re-sawed red oak, hard maple, purple heart... Never a broken blade, any issues with accuracy, this saw has made me buy many other wen products. Just buy it, or save more and get the rikon 10-326
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot heavier than expected but that's a good thing. The legs are stamped metal but a thicker than most of the tool stands. It was fairly easy to put together and set up. The only aggravating part the table the screws didn't want to start at first but went in fine after a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlan

customer_reviews.title: This is a properly made tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this WEN unit for cutting aluminum primarily. The product is great for this task. I ordered a 1/2" 18 TPI metal cutting blade, dialed it in with a few adjustments and has been performing excellently. I'm very impressed how straight and smoothly it cuts. Glad I got this model with the stand, light, and slower speed. The real bonus was the fence which I use constantly. Super value for a slick saw!
customer_reviews.author: Fact Finder II

customer_reviews.title: Good economy bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with this bandsaw. You get what you pay for. This is not a heavy duty tool for production. It’s meant for light duty work and it works just fine. With that in mind I give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy from Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it, quality so poor it didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. Legs on stand were not level, quality felt poor in general and the blade will not track on the wheels correctly no matter how much time was spent trying to adjust. Thankfully Amazon does allow refunds, because this thing was not usable.
customer_reviews.author: ChazinPA

customer_reviews.title: Not made the same as original one
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the saw after I started to put it together, I had seen the saw on YouTube but they have changed quite a bit, No CASTIRON table and some other parts they dropped. It works ok if you put in a lot of hours adjusting everything, including having to add things to make adjustments. I would have sent it back but didn't' seem to be any benchtop saw much better, you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Louis H. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Slow going for Metal Cutting.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this band saw to help with some crafts I am working on. It arrived as promised and was very easy to set up. Even blade changes are easy. I changed out the wood blade for a metal cutting blade, it will cut metal, but very SLOWLY, not sure if it is powered enough for this, but I think if I take it slow, it will cut the metal I need it to. I would buy it again, good price for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: SpyDad

customer_reviews.title: Sight line of cut not clear, or lit well.
customer_reviews.text: I like the saw for build quality. The two things that bug me are; The light is great, but useless where it is positioned. If it were three inches longer it may reach a useful spot. The upper arm is so engaged in bearings and shrouding, the actual cut is very hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: A real bargain for the money and my needs!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bandsaw I have owned. I have been doing woodwork for about two years. I make country/rustic furniture. This was a very simple saw to set up, basically just attaching the table and the fence. I left all the adjustments for the blade it came with alone. The saw cut beautifully. I am using it on a work table and not the stand that it came with. I read a lot of reviews on this and other saws and felt this was the best for my needs and am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I do not know where these are made or from where the raw materials are sourced, but keep up the good work... these are well-made machines. Don't let this one go to your heads and hike the price, I almost didn't buy this one; again, these machines are well-made...
customer_reviews.author: Fixer

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD
customer_reviews.text: RECEIVED IT ON TIME, VERY WELL PACKAGED, SET UP RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX, THE STAND WAS EASY ENOUGH TO PUT TOGETHER, SOLID PIECES OF EQUIPMENT. ONLY HAD TO ADJUST THE TABLE A LITTLE BIT (EASY TO DO), RAN A FEW TEST CUTS AND AM VERY VERY PLEASED. FOR THE PRICE AN EXCELLENT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: xtrmplay50

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: Put it together in about 30 minutes. Went together easy and came with everything you need to do it. The blade needed a little bit of tuning but it was close enough right out of the box to use for general work. After tuning I got perfect 90 degree cuts and nice curves that were just what I needed for minimal sanding. The table insert sits just below the table but not enough to make a huge difference. Wish it was about 3-4” taller, but a box can be built to get it to the height id like. Perfect addition to my home shop.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Wrigley

customer_reviews.title: Good choice but see my comments
customer_reviews.text: Works great but three caveats: 1. The miter attachment slide is so wobbly in the table slot that you cannot create a precise cut with it. 2. The sawdust vacuum vent port is a non-standard diameter; I cannot figure out how to attach my Shop vac hose to it. There is no mention in the users manual about how to attach to the port. 3. Others have correctly commented about the need to spend considerable time and adjusting to get the blade and guides correctly aligned. ALL of the bearings must be checked and adjusted before use. For small jobs the saw is great. The rip fence is handy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: CoastalCreature

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought quite a few WEN products on Amazon. Have not been disappointed yet. Band saw is no exception. I have used it almost everyday. Sturdy construction, runs smooth, was easy to set up and cuts pretty darn well. I am still using the stock blade that came on the saw. Seems to be holding its edge very well. I recommend giving this band saw a try!
customer_reviews.author: Mike F. from Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Worth it just for the resaw capacity
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great bandsaw. The 6" resaw capacity is much better than any other similarly priced saws, and once set up, the saw cuts accurately and precisely. Like others have said, adjustments are very finicky, especially on smaller blades, and the included light is useless.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as a ten inch band saw, does not even come close
customer_reviews.text: Easy quick setup, instructions simple to follow, initial calibration easy to do with included tools, however it does not open to advertised height hence only three stars, otherwise good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.author: Ray Radank

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the cost
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent value for the cost. I've resawn a bunch of 5" wide cherry boards with it and I use it to cut curves in plywood and thinner stock. I do wish I could resaw 10" boards.....but for the cost savings I'm going to rip and resaw until I can justify getting something way more expensive. This is a great saw to add to my shop though.
customer_reviews.author: KYLE M.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: It may not be the best band saw out there, but for the price it's amazing. I had a few issues getting the band aligned and staying on track, but other than that it has been doing pretty good work. I would recommend it to any hobbyist or beginning woodworkers on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Martin

customer_reviews.title: 3/8" blade- part of the new machine was bad.
customer_reviews.text: The Band saw gave big problems at first. I first installed the blade that came with the saw and had nothing but inconsistent cuts. I tried every thing to do with adjustments and no luck, luckily I bought a couple backup blades made by Bosch and a wonderful thing happened-it works pretty well now.
customer_reviews.author: pought

customer_reviews.title: I am one happy camper at this point
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed other comments before I jumped on this saw. It's hot here so i only expected to get it together sections at a time. Well, in just over an hour, it was together and ready for the alignment checks. 15 minutes later and I was cutting wood. I cannot believe how fast this assembly went and all with the provided wrench (an actual wrench) that came with the unit. I am one happy camper at this point. The table top has been cleaned and waxed and i'm making saw dust. Doesn't get any better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Tutt

customer_reviews.title: Not as described ..twice
customer_reviews.text: Item description clearly said it came with a stand...first one came with no stand so I asked for a replacement then the replacment one also comes without a stand .
customer_reviews.author: bluish

customer_reviews.title: Wen bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked by the Wen 10" bandsaw. Right out of the box it cut perfectly. I even tried resawing with the supplied and it cut straight. I cut veneering less than 1/8" thick, it was within 5 thousanths all around. I don't think I could find a bandsaw for $253 that could do that reliably.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great budget bandsaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic bandsaw for the DIYer. It will cut just like any delta bandsaw but for a far better price. I have cut many projects on it and changing out blades is extremely easy
customer_reviews.author: JLCKai

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Setup is a pain, but once you get it together its a really good saw. It cuts nearly perfect thru hardwood at 4” thick with a a little bit of a wonder after that. Maybe i need a bit more adjusting but its well within reason for the project i did. My only complaint is the multi size dust collection port doesnt have a size that fits my system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay for the money...
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the saw, for the cost, but there’s some caveats: the plate is not Cast iron, which I thought I read; the fence is not only inaccurate but flimsy; and switching speeds is a task in itself. Pros are the dust ports are great and seal nicely and the blade it comes with isn’t awful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Excellent band saw for the price. This is my first time owning one but it does everything I need and works extremely well. Hoping it lasts me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The picture shows the lower wheel alinement adjusting bracket, on batter brands there is no need for this and the one we received both the top and bottom adjustment bolts threads were striped making it impossible to use the saw as the blade could not be centered and continually came off the wheel.
customer_reviews.author: todd6896

customer_reviews.title: I like this saw
customer_reviews.text: I like this saw. I've used bands from 1/4 to 1/2 inch successfully. Tuning it is a bit tedious but with practice I got efficient. It is not heavy duty but sufficient for the home shop. I use it a lot. Simple scroll stuff and resewing stock up to 5.5". It is adequate. I would buy it again. Good stand, good saw. Great shipping, easy assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband and he loves it! Has used it for several projects and enjoys the fact that it is extremely silent compared to his other tools.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel K.

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe how useful it is
customer_reviews.text: For some reason in my 50+ years of having a shop I never had a band saw so this is my first. Can't believe how useful it is. Can't compare Wen to other brands but I am real pleased with this one. Being able to scroll 4x4s is magic and this is one of the only ones in this price range that allows this. Real pleased customer.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner tool
customer_reviews.text: Ready out the box. Sturdy work horse. Not too end but I’m no pro either. Hobbiest at best and fits needs perfectly. Would recommend. Watch yer fingers!!!
customer_reviews.author: luis allende

customer_reviews.title: Two speed band saw
customer_reviews.text: Band saw is a bargain for the price. The two speed option is why I purchased this saw. Low speed works great on aluminum. Tried three different blades, wood and metal. Did not need any adjustments for tracking of blades. Very happy. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Properly tuned out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Read all of the reviews that said this band saw was difficult to set up and tune. My experience was the exact opposite. Perfectly dialed. Deflection right at 1/8. No tracking issues. I am a garage woodworker so for me this saw is great and a heck of a value for $. Maybe when I need to change the blade the story will be different but for out of the box it is fantastic Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: WEN 3962 Two-Speed Band Saw with Stand and Worklight, 10"
product_meta.description: Size:10 Inch| Style:Band Saw"Remember when power tools were actually powerful? Reminiscent of your Grandpa’s bandsaw, the WEN 10-Inch Two-Speed Band Saw is the perfect companion for any workshop. With a 3.5-amp motor and a 9-3/4 inch throat, this beast will attack boards with cuts up to six inches deep and 9-3/4 inches wide. Two-speed operation allows for speeds of either 1520 or 2620 FPM. The design of this saw uses 72-inch blades anywhere from 1/8 to 1/2 inches in size for a variety of both intricate and powerful cuts. The spacious work table measures in at 14 x 12-1/2 inches in size and can be swiveled up to 45 degrees. This package includes a flexible work light to illuminate the worktable, a 3-in-1 dust port to fit a variety of dust extractor hoses (1-3/4, 2-3/4, 4 inches), a fence for creating straight cuts, a miter gauge for angled cuts, and a stand. Ball-bearings give the blade smooth operation and a long lasting life for years of dependable service. The easy-to-assemble stand elevates the bandsaw without sacrificing space on the shop’s work bench. And because it’s a WEN product, your WEN 10-Inch Two-Speed Band Saw comes backed by a two-year warranty, a nationwide network of skilled service technicians and a friendly and helpful customer phone line all to make sure you remember WEN. Remember when you had a versatile and powerful woodworking saw? Remember WEN."
feature_bullets: 3.5 amp motor creates cuts up to six inches deep and 9-3/4 inches wide
Uses 72-inch blades anywhere from 1/8 to 1/2 inches in size
Spacious 14-1/8 x 12-1/2 inch work table bevels up to 45 degrees
Operates at two speeds of either 1520 or 2620 FPM
Optional stand allows for either floor standing or bench top applications
Includes a 2-year warranty, a stand, a work light, a 3-in-1 dust port, a fence, a miter gauge, and a 3/8-inch blade (6 TPI)
